column1: text

It's Time Tyler and Josh kill it on this album. I've listened to Regional at Best, 
Twenty One Pilots, Vessel, and now Blurryface and I must say, Tyler is an 
incredible musician. The amount of controversy and vulnerability he puts in 
EVERY. SINGLE. SONG. is something the industry is in serious lack of. And 
this album is no exception, though it's truly exceptional. I have been able 
to listen to this album back-to-back and the arrangement is incredible. 
Tons of variety, not only in the album, but the songs as well.*****

|-/ aMAZING ITS JUST SO FREAKIN AMAZING, EVERY SINGLE SONG IS PERFECTION TYLER 
& JOSH YOU HAVE DONE WELL. The must listen to's are probably Fairly Local, 
Heavydirtysoul, & Lane Boy (but the whole album is freakin amazing and take 
the time to listen to Message Man & Polarize)

Blurryface I enjoy every single song of the album, The Judge and Lane Boy are 
borderline however. Stressed Out is by far one of my all time favorite 
songs because of the lyric and rhyme scheme originality. Overall I 
definitely rate this album five stars!

Amazing band! Twenty one pilots is definitely twenty one genres merged into this band! 
Stressed out, Ride, and especially Fairly Local are my faves. I'm one of 
the few the proud and the emotional!!!!

Love them I think I made them popular everyone thought u ran their songs into the 
ground and then everyone was downloading their music and my sister hates 
music but LOOVVEESSS TØP and I love them more

The good stuff... Whatever the "good stuff" is... these guys find a way to deliver. Wide 
artistic range and the ability to please just about anyone with any song. 
Weather it be about conforming... March To The Sea (2009), is your song. 
Happiness, you've got House Of Gold (Vessel) and loneliness... you're 
spoiled for choice. This album is shaping up to be amazing, just like the 
artists themselves.

Yes please. Maintaining the unique, original sound is where this band excels. Always 
surprised, pleasantly, by Tyler and Josh's creativity. Being insecure and 
vulnerable has never been this much fun.

Favorite album of 2014 I've been a fan of Walk The Moon since the Tightrope EP was released, and 
I didn't think their next album could be better than their self-titled, and 
I was proven wrong! It has all type of moods, from upbeat to really dark 
(see Work This Body and then Up 2 U). Its a really fantastic album, and Im 
so excited what comes next for the boys! Favorite song: Spend Your $$$ or 
Portagual.

My favorite band now! I started listening to their songs because I had heard them on Pandora. I 
listened to some other songs. Soon, they became my favorites.

Reluctant Listen I was never a big fan during their first album, but when someone 
recommended this album on twitter, I had to listen. I was blown away. Every 
song is so catchy and fun. Portugal is my favorite. Probably makes my top 
five albums of 2014.

This is so Fun~ I love these guys! My fave song is Down in the Dumps! So flippin' good! 
Highly recommend this album while it's free!

Modern Pop-Rock Staple Let me preface this by stating that, despite being a long-time supporter 
of Pop music, I have noticed a significant decline in the overall quality 
of "modern radio" music, both in content and delivery. Walk the Moon's 
release, Talking is Hard, is like an oasis among the anemic, recycled pop 
tunes of recent years. They combine an Indie mind with an 80's Revival 
heart in a sonic rollercoaster ride that will guide you back to a time of 
content-rich, relatable, extraordinarily catchy choruses and hooks. 9/10.

Not what I expected I know bands evolve and develop but this isn't what I had in mind. They 
may have gotten too artsy/trendy for their own good. Absolutely adored the 
first album. Saw them in concert about two years ago with Bad Veins, 
arguably the best concert I've ever seen but this new album has yet to 
touch me. Yet to suprise and wow me. I hope it's coming but I won't hold my 
breath...

Best album ever This album is amazing and uplifting. I went to their March 10th San Diego 
concert and my boyfriend proposed to me during "Portugal," which is my 
favorite song. Gotta love Walk the Moon.

It's too bad they sound too much like a typical boyband in most of these 
songs... There are a few songs that represent what they're capable though
Omg so good Love. Love. Love. Love. Love.

Walk the Moon is Fantastic This album has a perfect, fun feel to it. All the songs have their own 
distinct style, yet they all fit together as uniquely Walk the Moon. This 
album is filled with fantastic songs that are a blast to listen to.

I reviewed this album for the school paper Walk the Moon is very big at my school and I know that if I wrote an album 
review on it, people would read it. I knew Ana Sun and Shut Up and Dance 
but when I first listened to this album, it sounded very pop. It's a 
well-produced album and it's overall really nice. A lot of the songs are 
catchy and fun to listen to (not so much Aquaman, in my opinion). I 
definitely recommend giving it a listen before judging it.

Church the chief This album is the best so far. I usually have 1 or 2 songs on his cds I 
don't like but I love every song on this album! Continue making cds like 
this! Completely in love with it.

Not "Chief", but a solid effort Outside of "Taladega" (which, melodically sounds eerily similar to 
"Sinners Like Me"), and "Give Me Back My Hometown", this album lacks the 
instant classics. But there aren't any bad songs either. They're a solid 
bunch, worthy of your money and concert ticket, just not the group of 
timeless classics that "Chief" produced.

Excellent This album is able to go back and forth from a classic country song full 
of heart to a rock song that challenges the ideals of the establishment

He just can't make a bad album! Just cant! & that's why I come back for

One of the all time greats, Eric Church! Ive been waiting for this album to come out for months, and it will not 
disappoint. Keep goin strong EC!

True artist Eric has made it known that his music is not for everyone. No, he doesn't 
follow traditional country roots and had came under fire for it. But he 
does not want to follow. This album shows how truly creative he is. He is 
original. There is no other artist out there like him. If you want 
mainstream music, please go somewhere else. But if you like a man that 
plays music for those that are outsiders and never fit in and are outcasts 
like he is, get this album and you will hear music that comes from the 
soul.

Exactly what I need... Seen Eric perform a week ago, bought his latest and I listen to it 
constantly. I'm loving Wrecking Ball. So sultry, seductive, sexy and full 
of masculinity. Excellent album, both lyrically and musically. Well 
written. A prelude to a tailgate, Jack and a bonfire.

AWESOME I'm a little upset that this album is not included in the All Access, but 
it is well worth the Buy. Eric Church never lets you down!

Love love love This is an awesome album to add to Eric's collection of great records. 
Getting into it took no time and there's a different component to each song 
that I love. The guitar play in Broke Record is awesome. I've already got 
my ticket to the upcoming tour and I can't wait to see him Live my 4th year 
in a row. Amazing
Not worth the money Give me back my hometown is the best song the others suck.

Great album Eric Church is the best TRUE ARTIST in all of music. If you like 
cookie-cutter pop country, DO NOT buy this album and give it a bad rating 
because this isn't regular country music. Its many different genres blended 
into one album. Just buy it and listen to it. Eric is a musical genius.

Horrible What is Eric Church thinking ? F.Y.I. to Eric, Be yourself Dude & Create 
Some True Country Music of Your Own that's Worth Listening to ! ! !

Great album! I love that Eric has said he doesn't want to make the same record twice. 
He wants every album to be unique and new, The Outsiders is a great album, 
worth every penny and make sure you listen to it in order first, there's a 
reason. Enjoy!

Buy it today! Never a disappointment from Eric Church. Another one to put on repeat for

Memories into words. Songs that compliment the honesty. The times we'll 
never forget. Now this is country at its finest. The rebellious, truthful, and freedom 
of putting together these melodies.

Country music's rebel Hats off to Eric for putting out a great record. After the success of 
Chief, it would have been very easy to go into the studio and make Chief 2. 
But that's not Church. Instead he basically said F you to the record 
company and put out the record he wanted, with new sounds and adventurous 
songs that isn't filled with #1 singles. That would have been to easy and 
so unrebel like.

Great album, great sound Love this album as it has songs that are clearly mainstream, but then 
others that are not at all. I'd have given it 5 stars but the Prelude on 
Devil, Devil should have come with an option to skip - spoken word is NOT 
my taste.

Super album! I love Eric Chruch. This album will be in heavy rotation just like the 
others. However, I am going to cancel my Google Music All Access if these 
albums aren't available on day of release. That is why I figured it was 
worth paying $9.99 per month. Guess I might as well cancel, and buy the 
album for $8 from Amazon.

Don't actually get a download of music. Be careful when buying music on Google Play. You don't actually get a

Changing the rules... and I love it! We know he could have easily done "just another Chief", but

1000 Forms Of Fear This bus an outstanding comeback from Sia. Her vocals throughout the 
record are absolutely incredible. She is an outstanding lyricist and create 
soulful lyrics sparking thought and emotion. Some great songs are 
CHANDELIER, BIG GIRLS CRY, FREE THE ANIMAL and DRESSED IN BLACK. But if you 
really want good sound quality, (well, who doesn't?) then support your 
local record shop by purchasing the CD or the Vinyl. Because they are 
always superior to digital in every way. Plus you get lyrics and artwork!

1000 Forms of Fear Realised An album for deep thinkers and the displaced. Also for the happy, the 
quirky and those that love genuine melodies. If your background is heavily 
sheltered you may love the music more than the videos. An uplifting 
near-perfect pop album. Sia's gift for pop writing is lovingly matched with 
her out-of-this-world voice, but unmatched by her peers, and this album 
shines new light on her talents - it features songs that no one else 
wanted, and (probably causing the first point) tracks too personal or too 
unsingable for anyone else as Sia reaches heights with her voice I didn't 
know existed. Dark corners and bright guiding lights throughout. Oh, if you 
wind up imagining your head in a blonde wig flinging yourself round the 
house it's ok, it's totally totally ok.

A true artist, much beauty and creativity. Beautiful album, truly beautiful. This album has so much creativity and so 
much emotions; Sia has great vocals in the track and it's easy to tell that 
this album is truly a masterpiece. It's been a long time since this album 
has been sold for the first time yet this album still remains to amaze me. 
Sia's song writing is truly phenomenal. I believe Sia will become a legend 
as a artist, her use of language, the use of emotive cracks and her use of 
art forms truly shows that she will be remembered.

Sia is an amazing artist and 1000 Forms of Fear is proof! Sia’s 1000 Forms of Fear is stunning! Each track on the album evokes a 
different emotion. Excitement, sadness, hope, and of course fear. This is 
without a doubt the best album of the year!

An Unexpected Crush Sought this record out after falling in love with 'Elastic Heart'. Sia is

beautiful! I listen from the beginning, straight through the end. Best 
purchase I've made in a long time!

Rap Album of the Year? No just album of the Year This project has no flaws. It's pure clear VS1 Clarity. The intro, thought 
it was a drought, brought us the great line about gucci flip flops and it 
sys the tone for the test of the album. His only feature on the album, 
Where Ya At with Drake, should be a song that is constantly played on the 
radio. Musical production on this is superb. No one beat out shines the 
other. He thankfully includes his hits from his 56 nights, Beast Mode and 
Monster project which just strengthen the project more. 10/10
